whatever.translation[0].definitions[0].d: any or all of the things that are wanted, needed, or possible
whatever.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Help yourself to whatever you want.
The children were allowed to do whatever they liked.
He’ll be ready to accept whatever help he can get.
I am willing to pay whatever price you ask.
whatever.translation[0].definitions[1].d: used to say that it is not important what happens, what you do etc because it does not change the situation
whatever.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Whatever I suggest, he always disagrees.
The building must be saved, whatever the cost.
If you are unable to attend the interview, for whatever reason, you should inform us immediately.
whatever.translation[0].definitions[2].d: used to say that you do not know the exact meaning of something, or the exact name of someone or something
whatever.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The doctor says she’s got fibrositis, whatever that is.
Why don’t you invite Seb, or whatever he’s called, to supper?
whatever.translation[0].definitions[3].d: used when asking a question to emphasize that you are surprised or slightly angry about something
whatever.translation[0].definitions[3].e: ‘Did you know she’s dyed her hair orange?’ ‘Whatever next?’
whatever.translation[0].definitions[4].d: used as a reply to say that you do not care what is done or chosen, or that the exact details of something do not matter
whatever.translation[0].definitions[4].e: ‘What flavour do you want? Strawberry, vanilla ...?’ ‘Whatever.’
whatever.translation[1].definitions[0].d: used to emphasize a negative statement
whatever.translation[1].definitions[0].e: She has shown no interest whatever in anything scientific.
This is just a stupid argument that has nothing whatever to do with your job.
